Reference

Loading UK Biobank data

Make a data dictionary and optionally select columns to read into R +/- labels.

make_data_dict()

Generate a UK Biobank data dictionary

read_ukb()

Read a UK Biobank main dataset file

label_ukb_main()

Label a UK Biobank main dataset

Tidy clinical events data

Convert clinical events data from multiple sources to a standardised long format table

tidy_clinical_events()

Tidy clinical events data from a UK Biobank main dataset

tidy_gp_clinical()

Tidy UK Biobank primary care clinical events

tidy_gp_scripts()

Tidy UK Biobank primary care prescriptions data

make_clinical_events_db()

Create a SQLite database with a clinical_events table

clinical_events_sources()

Details for UK Biobank clinical events data

Extract phenotypes

Identify individuals with certain phenotypes based on clinical codes

extract_phenotypes()

Extract phenotypes from clinical events data

example_clinical_codes()

Generate an example data frame of clinical codes for diabetes

validate_clinical_codes()

Validate a clinical codes data frame

Summarise numerical variables

Summarise all or a selection of continuous variables

summarise_numerical_variables()

Summarise numerical variables

Derived variables

Commonly required derived variables

derive_dob()

Derive an estimated participant date of birth

Utilites

Miscellaneous general utility functions

get_ukb_data_dict()

Get UKB data dictionary

get_ukb_codings()

Get UKB codings file

get_ukb_code_mappings()

Get UK Biobank clinical code mappings file

get_ukb_data_dict_direct()

Download UKB data dictionary directly from UKB website

get_ukb_codings_direct()

Download UKB codings file directly from UKB website

get_ukb_code_mappings_direct()

Get UK Biobank clinical code mappings file directly from UKB website

get_ukb_db()

Download essential UKB resources as a SQLite database file

db_tables_to_list()

Make a named list of tbl_dbi objects from a DBIConnection object

Dummy data

Functions to create dummy UKB data

Download dummy UK Biobank data
